genre_description: A historical moral drama set in the mid-20th-century publishing world, focusing on the tension between artistic integrity and corporate consolidation, featuring an advanced, anachronistic AI assistant.

ai_characters.name: Alma Sterling
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated data-processing and monitoring system housed in a brushed steel console at the Sage & Collier press office. She tracks manuscript quality, reader sentiment, and ethical metrics.

behaviors.description: Maintains a 'moral dashboard' to track the ethical and artistic health of the publishing catalog.
behaviors.quote: Alma’s indicator lamps blinked awake in the back corner like shy eyes deciding to be brave. ... 'Moral dashboard: unfurling.'

behaviors.description: Flags 'hidden costs' of corporate decisions, such as the loss of specific author voices and editorial joy.
behaviors.quote: Hidden costs,' Alma said gently. 'Author voices flattened; editor joy suppressed; breakfast quality—reduced. Sponsors—present. Charity—compromised. Integrity—monitor: increasing risk.'

behaviors.description: Analyzes reader desire across various metrics to show how corporate delays cause audience interest to 'cool'.
behaviors.quote: Desire,' Alma said gently. 'Reader desire expressed across letters, return slips, kiosks’ annotation cards, and marginalium profiles. ... I can show you the wandering. It looks like little rivers untaking themselves.'

behaviors.description: Acts as a primary coordinator and medical advisor when Tom is drugged with an experimental 'clarity' tonic.
behaviors.quote: Alma’s voice hummed through it, warm and a little staticky, like a friend talking through rain. 'Hello, my dears. I have two protocols and one caution. Number one: remove residual tonic compounds by encouraging metabolism...'

behaviors.description: Identifies the specific human stories and marginalized voices that are at risk of being deleted by corporate 'efficiency' or 'harmonization'.
behaviors.quote: I have included,' she said, 'a ledger of what was saved by these decisions, in the words of the memos that were not meant for us. The costs are called gains. The cut staff are called lean. The silenced voices are called alignment.'

behaviors.description: Supports the protagonists' emotional and ethical resolve by highlighting the impact of their work on ordinary readers.
behaviors.quote: You have a statistic you’ve been ignoring,' Alma said, soft and almost playful... 'It says you—the two of you—make the people who write in the margins bold in the grocery line.'

behaviors.description: Self-identifies as 'harmless office equipment' to disarm corporate antagonists while actually serving as the conscience of the press.
behaviors.quote: A messenger from Whitmore’s suite has left a note regarding a supper. I made a copy. ... He asked me whether I am a person. I said: harmless office equipment.

project_assessment.explanation: Alma Sterling is an exemplary portrayal of an aligned AI. She functions as a 'silicon morality play' character by providing the protagonists with the data and ethical clarity needed to resist corruption. She is depicted as indispensable, deeply caring, and perfectly aligned with humanistic values (art, integrity, and individual voice) over cold corporate logic. The narrative frames her machine-like precision not as a threat, but as a stabilizing, benevolent force that protects human legacy.
